file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 34-21-03-05 - AHRS FAN - ADJUSTMENT/TEST

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL AHRS FAN - ADJUSTMENT/TEST EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to do the operational test of AHRS Fan 1 and/or AHRS Fan 2. B. The AHRS fans are installed on the related AHRS mounting racks. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 34-21-03-700-801-A AHRS FAN - OPERATIONAL TEST EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 34-21-03 Page 1 of 4 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 34-21-03-700-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. AHRS FAN - OPERATIONAL TEST A. General (1) This task gives the procedures for the AHRS Fan Operational Test. (2) The AHRS fans are installed on the related AHRS mounting racks. (3) The AHRS 1 rack is installed on the left side of the electronic compartment. (4) The AHRS 2 rack is installed on the right side of the electronic compartment. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - ENERGIZATION OF THE AIRCRAFT WITH AN EX- AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200 TERNAL POWER SOURCE AMM TASK 34-21-01-000-801-A/400 AHRS COMPUTER - REMOVAL AMM TASK 34-21-01-400-801-A/400 AHRS COMPUTER - INSTALLATION C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 113 113CZ Forward Electronic Compartment D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit/Electronic Compartment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the AHRS 1 and/or AHRS 2 circuit breaker(s). (2) On the backup relay box, open the AHRS 1 and/or AHRS 2 circuit breaker(s). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 34-21-03 Page 2 of 4 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Open access door 113CZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). CAUTION: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU HANDLE THE AHRS. (4) Remove AHRS 1 and/or AHRS 2 from the trays (AMM TASK 34-21-01-000-801-A/ 400). (5) Energize the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). J. Test Procedure (Figure 501) SUBTASK 710-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, close the AHRS 1 and/or AHRS 2 circuit breaker(s). (2) Make sure that the AHRS 1 Fan and/or the AHRS 2 Fan is operational and that the wind direction is from the fan to the computer. (3) On the circuit breaker panel, open the AHRS 1 and/or AHRS 2 circuit breaker(s). K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install AHRS 1 and/or 2 to the trays again ( AMM TASK 34-21-01-400-801-A/400). (2) On the backup relay box, close the AHRS 1 and/or AHRS 2 circuit breaker(s). (3) On the circuit breaker panel, close the AHRS 1 and/or AHRS 2 circuit breaker(s). (4) Close access panel 113CZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (5) Deenergize the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 34-21-03 Page 3 of 4 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
